With Planned Parenthood the biggest recipient of those funds, Mike Pence said Americans should be "shocked" that the organization "has been recorded aiding and abetting underage sex trafficking." The recent release of an undercover video exposing duplicity and potential criminality by an employee of Planned Parenthood is an outrage, Mike Pence said. "The time to deny any and all funding to Planned Parenthood is now." He urged Congress to immediately bring his bill, which would end family planning grants for abortion providers,

staff to search children for any material that may disrupt lessons feature in the Bill, while rules forcing schools to give parents 24 hours notice of a detention will also be scrapped. Mr Michael Gove said: This Government backs teachers. All the evidence from those countries with great education systems tells us that nothing is more important than attracting great people into teaching and supporting them in the classroom. "Teachers will be free to impose the penalties they need to keep order and free from the red tape which swallows up teaching time, so they can get on with their first duty- raising standards. Plans to axe a number of education quangos will feature in the bill, as will the legislation required to allow Government to charge university students higher rates of interest on tuition fee loans.
